item.title: Dozens of journalists honoured with South Asian Hero Award 2026
item.description: The SAARC Foundation established in Sri Lanka has honoured various individuals from Nepal, India, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka who have contributed to democracy, human rights and freedom of the press and expression with the South Asian Hero Award 2026. They were honoured during a special program organ

item.title: Chattogram-bound cargo ship sinks near Thailand’s Phuket, crew rescued
item.description: MV SEALLOYD ARC, a Chittagong Port-bound Panama-flagged vessel carrying cargo from Malaysia, has sunk off the coast of Thailand’s Phuket. The vessel sank on Saturday afternoon. All 16 Bangladeshi crew members aboard were rescued. According to the ship’s Bangladeshi agent Alvi Lines B

item.title: Voters secretly decided whom they’ll vote: Nahid
item.description: National Citizen Party (NCP) Convener Nahid Islam said on Sunday that the people of Bangladesh have already decided in secret whom they will vote for and are set to carry out that ‘great act’ on Thursday. item.title: India-EU trade deal: a brief review
item.description: The European Union (EU) and India is signing free trade agreement that both sides have hailed as 'the mother of all deals'. item.title: Partnership for a new global AI discourse
item.description: The advent of artificial intelligence marks a consequential inflection point in the trajectory of technological evolution. item.title: Penchant for last-minute sensitive deals
item.description: The Japan-Bangladesh Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA) signed between the two countries on Friday last is likely to take the bilateral cooperation and collaboration to a new high. item.title: What sways the voter perception
item.description: A local think tank, the Centre for Policy Dialogue (CPD), last Saturday (February 9) presented the findings of a survey it conducted on what the voters as well as political party representatives and candidates understood by the word 'development'. item.title: Flagship EPA with Japan
item.description: The Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA) between Bangladesh and Japan is significant not only because it marks Dhaka's first such deal with any country, but also because it offers a blueprint for trade diplomacy in the run-up to the LDC graduation. item.title: 14,000 selected as primary teachers after fast-track exams
item.description: The Directorate of Primary Education has published the final results of recruitment for assistant teachers in government primary schools, appointing 14,384 candidates across 61 districts. The results were released on Sunday night on the directorate’s website, just a week after the oral exams

item.title: Interim govt defers dealing with power, energy graft to next govt
item.description: Energy Advisor Muhammad Fouzul Kabir Khan has said the interim government has sent documents and information on corruption in the power and energy sector to the relevant authorities, leaving final decisions on the matter to the next government. He spoke to reporters on Sunday evening at the Bidyut

item.title: Polls spur money flows into mkt heightening inflation fear
item.description:
Election-centric money flows from and into the banking system surge as Bangladesh goes to the polls soon, with a domino effect on the economy.As the money market and public wallets fatten, a worrisome major macroeconomic parameter-inflation-takes in some new heat, analysts say.

item.title: Tarique Rahman calls vigilance to protect voting rights
